title: New Samsung Flip Phone (2018): W2019 release date, specs and price
description:
![Samsung flip
phone](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg) Credit: Samsung

**Samsung is inching closer and closer to the release its next-generation
SM-W2019 flip phone, if the latest rumours are to be believed – and it could
rival its most powerful flagships.**

While all eyes are now firmly trained on next year’s [Galaxy
S10](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/galaxy-s10-release-date-specs-
rumours-3456012) flagship (and of course the mythical [Galaxy
X](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/samsung-galaxy-x-release-date-specs-
price-2951423) foldable phone, if and when that arrives), Samsung continues to
spread its bets across the mobile market – as evidenced by the recently
revealed mid-range [Galaxy A9
(2018)](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-a9).

It hasn’t forgotten about flip phones, either, and could be on the verge of
unveiling a new throwback handset, according to recent reports.

The latest leak
[comes](https://www.weibo.com/6126467413/GEA5hkERC?type=comment) to us from
Chinese social network Weibo ([H/T](https://www.sammobile.com/2018/10/22/new-
samsung-flip-phone-images-leaked-again/) _SamMobile_ ) and allegedly shows off
hands-on photos of the Samsung W2019.

Like last year’s Samsung flip phone, its a loosely clamshell build that
features a pair of displays – one of the outside of the device when its
closed, and another that sits above its physical keyboard when opened.

That’s about all that can seemingly be verified – the images are decidedly
fuzzy, and there’s nothing that clearly differentiates the device in-hand from
last year’s W2018 Samsung flip phone, so who knows if they’re the real deal or
just the latest mobile hoax.

Prior to this, it was [spied](https://www.mysmartprice.com/gear/samsung-flip-
phone/) by _MySmartPrice_ that the device had apparently passed through
China’s MIIT certification body, which paves the way for it be approved by
other agencies in the country – namely TENAA – in the near future.

**Related:[Best Android phones](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-
android-phones-3438996)**

![Samsung flip
phone](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Image Credit: MySmartPrice

Earlier still, a Wi-Fi Alliance listing for the SM-W2019 was spotted, which
revealed that while Samsung’s 2019 flip phone will ship with the older
[Android 8.0 Oreo](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/android-8-0-oreo)
operating system, it will support the future-facing
[802.11ac](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinion/802-11ac-vs-802-11n-what-s-
the-difference-2905251) Wi-Fi standard (now known as [Wi-Fi
6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/what-is-wi-fi-6-new-wi-fi-
names-3598675)), which suggests the presence of a new-gen SoC under the hood –
Qualcomm’s [Snapdragon
845](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/snapdragon-845-benchmark-phones-
speed-3390981) being the likeliest chip to feature.

As a further idea of what to expect from the Samsung W2019 flip phone, last
year’s W2018 sported a pair of Full HD AMOLED display measuring 4.2 inches
each. Given that device offered a 12-megapixel primary camera spec similar
(but not identical) to Samsung’s 2017 flagships, it wouldn’t be a surprise to
see the W2019 come with two 12-megapixel rear sensors, as dual camera setups
are now very much in vogue.

An upgraded 8-megapixel front ‘selfie cam’ has also been mooted, but as ever,
these specs are purely conjuncture at this stage – we hope to learn more soon.

One final thing to note is that last year’s Samsung flip phone wasn’t overly
affordable. Its price cleared the £1000 mark when converted from yuan, meaning
you could likely bag a [Galaxy
S9](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-s9) or [iPhone
XS](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/iphone-xs) for a similar outlay.
Plus, the W20118 only appears to have been released in China, so you might not
be able to buy one, even if you wanted to.

Still, Samsung’s next premium flip phone could well offer some clues as to
what to expect from its next mainstream releases, so we’re intrigued.

Watch this space.

**Should Samsung release a premium flip phone in the UK? Let us know over on
Twitter @TrustedReviews.**
